locations: ca, canada, yukon, whitehorse, y1a 4p1, black street, , 60.72444781326983, -135.05472548949632
short_description: fireweed community market is a fruit & vegetable market based in whitehorse, yukon, canada.
long_description: we celebrate yukon culture at our markets 'where local happens'. our mandate "the fireweed community market society is an enduring cooperative community of people who wish to promote diverse and conscientious local production and consumption.". the fireweed community market society has been operating in whitehorse since 2005 on the land of ta'an kwäch'än council and kwanlin dün first nation. we promote the production and consumption of yukon products. we offer authentic experiences to residents and tourists by supporting local entrepreneurs and small businesses and directly connecting consumers with producers of quality goods that are locally grown, raised, wild-harvested, or hand-crafted -the fireweed community market society in whitehorse. since 2005, a volunteer board has guided the strategic and operational success of our non-profit society, with the support of part-time and seasonal staff, over 250 members and hundreds of volunteer hours. long term funding from the canadian agricultural partnership program provides significant support.
business_tags: agricultural programs | local happenings | farm gates | locally grown | vendor members
generated_description: fireweed community market, legally known as fireweed community market society, based in whitehorse, yukon, is a non-profit organization established in 2005. the society promotes the production and consumption of local yukon products, supports local entrepreneurs, and provides authentic experiences for visitors. it operates various markets, including an outdoor market and a 12 days of christmas market, and offers agricultural programs. the organization acknowledges the land of ta’an kwäch’än council and kwanlin dün first nation and celebrates the unique histories, languages, and cultures of the 14 first nations in the area. fireweed community market society is supported by long-term funding from the canadian agricultural partnership program.
